subject: Creativity
title: 3M and the Post-it Note: Innovation by Accident
description: A short lesson to help you apply 3M and the Post-it Note: Innovation by Accident.

hook.text: Spencer Silver invented an adhesive that didn't stick properly. His boss called it useless.

buildup.text: Silver's weak adhesive was a 'failed' experiment at 3M. But 3M had a policy: employees could spend 15% of time on.

discovery.text: His colleague Art Fry realized the weak glue was perfect for bookmarks that wouldn't damage pages.

twist.text: 3M's first market test flopped â€” people didn't understand Post-its until they USED them.

climax.text: 3M's innovation culture (15% time, tolerance for failure, cross-pollination) has produced 60,000+ products.

punchline.text: The Post-it Note: a failed glue, used by the wrong person, for the wrong.

quiz.question: What 3M policy allowed Spencer Silver to keep developing his 'failed' adhesive?
options: 15% of work time for personal projects
